intro: Pilea somae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-20 centimeters, with its foliage often featuring a velvety texture. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, bloom from the center of the plant, adding to its ornamental appeal. Pilea somae thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
